body.p: Gentoo 주간 뉴스는 Gentoo 사용자들에게 Gentoo 관련 정보를 제공할 하나의 소식통을 제공하는 것이 목적입니다. GWN은 한주동안 Gentoo Linux 프로젝트에서 일어난 핵심적인 이벤트들을 요약해서 명확하고 간결한 형식으로 보여줍니다. 일반적인 소식, 보안, 버그, portage 그리고 다른 토픽들로, GWN은 모든 사람들에게 무언가를 제공할 것입니다. GWN의 현재 버전은 언제나 여기에서 찾을 수 있습니다.
현재까지, GWN은 웹과 메일링 리스트 형식으로 배포되고 있고, 여러분의 피드백을 기반으로 다른 형식이 추가될 수 있습니다. GWN 메일링 리스트를 구독하려면, gentoo-gwn-subscribe@gentoo.org 로 빈 이메일을 보내세요. GWN은 또한 사람들이 자발적으로 번역에 참여함으로써, 다른 언어로도 볼 수 있을 것입니다.
마지막으로, 우리는 GWN이 한 주마다 나올 수 있게 만들어준 많은 봉사자들에게 감사드리고 싶습니다. 공헌자에서 번역자와 보이지 않는 곳에서 일하는 많은 사람들까지, 모든 사람들이 여러분에게 GWN을 보여주는 것을 도와주고 있습니다. 만약 여러분이 GWN 팀에 참여하는 데 관심이 있다면, gwn-feedback@gentoo.org로 이메일을 보내 주세요.

tr.ti: 다가오는 FOSDEM, 리투아니아 번역자 모집, Andrea Barisani의 초상화
Gentoo 문서 프로젝트 상태 업데이트 Gentoo 여름 캠프 2006 주최자 forum, Gentoo home media center, Gentoo 서버 위의 KDE.news
Qt4가 Portage 안으로 들어갈 준비 중, Alpha 프로젝트 상태 업데이트, GWN 가이드 릴리스됨, Gentoo Forums 통계 보여짐
gcc 3.4.4가 x86에서 안정화 됨, Power.org가 무료로 개발자 멤버쉽을 제공, 100,000명의 등록된 Gentoo Forum 사용자들, 기여자 요청, Bangalore FOSS.IN, Linuxtage Essen
xsupplicant 사장시키기에 대한 의견 요청, Bangalore에서의 FOSS.IN, Yokohama에서의 Bonenkai
Schloss Kransberg에서의 두번째 유럽 Gentoo 개발자 회의 리포트, phpgroupware가 트리에서 제거됨, 일부 아키텍쳐들을 위한 2005.1-r1릴리스, RSS feed를 통한 GWN
Stage3이 이제 기본 인스톨 방법이 됨, Douglas Robertson과 그의 Gentoo 기반의 video jukebox들에 관한 인터뷰, Frankfurt/Main 지역에서 개최된 LWE와 DevCon 에서의 Gentoo
GLEP 42 (중요한 뉴스 보고), Brenntag Nordic의 Jacob Lindberg 와의 인터뷰, 이탈리아의 GeCHI 컨퍼런스
새 한국어 GWN 번역, subforum 소개, Portage 진보
Gentoo Linux/MIPS SGI LiveCD 와 Cobalt stage가 릴리스됨
Flagedit, subforums가 소개됨, MySQL 4.1이 stable 트리로 이동
Gnome 2.12, LWE London report, Oberhausen GUM
Python 2.4 업데이트, Gentoo/ALT 프로젝트 뉴스, 번역자 모집
ebuild 제작자들을 위한 새 IRC 채널, 유럽 Gentoo 개발자 회의 문서 요청
Gentoo council meeting, European Gentoo developer conference announcement
Apache package updates
Gentoo Council elections, PHP4/5 announcement, new TOR policy in the Forums
Gentoo documentation updates, Swedish rescue CD for PegasosPPC released
Report about LWE San Francisco, User projects (car console and MythTV)
2005.1 released, first US Gentoo developer conference webcast from San Francisco
First Gentoo Installer, Tor users are blocked on Forums
Gentoo Developer conference in San Francisco, German translators seeking, Bugday 2nd anniversary, User Interview
Bug 100,000, keeping gentoo-sources-2.4
Discontinuing gentoo-2.4-sources, hardware donations, first IA64 LiveCD, bugzilla upgrade
Gentoo documentation status update, 2.5 million forum posts, Greek translators seek reinforcement
Gentoo developer receives award, LinuxTag report, AMD64 development hardware ready for use
Gentoo store under new management, LinuxTag in Karlsruhe, Gentoo Forums admin and mods become regular staff members, hardware donations to the Forums
New Open Desktop Workstations with Gentoo preinstalled, Gentoo/MIPS experimental LiveCD, gendocedit released
Python 2.4 unmasked, busybox glitches contained
AMD64 hardware donations, documentation updates
'Emergency issue', Trustees election and OSDL article
Printing herd recruits new members, staff and software changes at forums.gentoo.org
Unofficial Gentoo development guide, OpenLDAP update
Project Dolphin, new mailing lists
Documentation updates, release engineering meeting minutes, new LiveDVD for PPC
Cosmetic touches to the website, forum staff reshuffle
April fool's jokes, webrsync revisited, donation report
Gentoo 2005.0 released, PayPal donations, SSL support for Bugzilla, Open Source Conference in Tokyo
Documentation additions and updates, Open Source Conference in Tokyo
Gentoo UK conference report, Planet Gentoo launched, ODW sales begin, Lörrach IT/Linux Days
2005.0 security rebuild, infrastructure changes, sys-apps moves
First European Gentoo developer meeting, FOSDEM report, news from the Apache herd, Gentoo/FreeBSD documentation
LWE Boston report, FOSDEM, Gentoo UK conference, RSS-feeds, Gentoo on a Kuro-Box
Gentoo Forums migrated to new hard- and software, event reminders, interview with Thierry Carrez, Open-Xchange in Gentoo Linux
Linux World Expo in Boston, two million posts at forums.gentoo.org, new mailing list and IRC channel for media packages
Trusted Gentoo, AMD64 looking for help, Gentoo/PPC GameCD
Gentoo/OpenSolaris, kernel profiles for 2005.0, Genesi Open Desktop Workstations, Mac Mini booting Gentoo Linux/PPC, FOSDEM pre-announcement
Gentoo trademark and logo guidelines, new GWN translations, goals for 2005, LWE Boston
Forum attacker fought off, 2.6.10 kernel stable, Gentoo lectures at MIT, Canadian elementary school Gentoo LTSP project
Gentoo Forums 1000 days anniversary, website redesign and documentation updates, call for Polish contributors, GentooJP Bounenkai report
Second anniversary of the Gentoo Weekly Newsletter, new buildtime and stats database client, 2004 bugzilla statistics
Call for speakers at Gentoo UK event, new Catalyst mailing list, GWN translators needed
New Chinese Gentoo Forum, Bonenkai in Tokyo, USE flag editors
Gentoo Developer Meetings in Berlin (December) and Manchester (February), 2004.3 maintenance release, Gentoo on a stick
Genesi announces PegasosPPCs with preinstalled Gentoo, central script repository, new Turkish GWN mailing list operational
Gentoo Linux 2004.3 on DVD, advanced Portage development, documentation updates
Gentoo Linux 2004.3 released, kernel tree revisited, new section: Future zone
User Survey results, Italian Gentoo Day
LWE in Germany, call for Java developers, Gentoo Bugday
Portage 2.0.51 released, website redesign contest result, Haskell developers needed, documentation update, LWE in Germany, UK GUM in Cambridge
2004.3 Release Beta versions available soon, new lead translator for Japanese GWN, Munich Gentoo User Group event
Portage hits 100,000 files, PegasosPPC donations to Gentoo developers, Penguin webcam in the Antarctis
Final stage of the website redesign contest, report from the International Gentoo PPC Dev Meeting, driver changes in Portage'
Gentoo documentation updates, new section 'Gentoo in the press'
First Official Gentoo User Survey, Forum Software Embellishments, Gentoo PPC Developer Meeting
Leave of Yuji Carlos Kosugi as GWN main editor, new minimal LiveCD
New bugday website, several project updates and an interview with Deedra Waters
Forums migration to new hardware complete.
Gentoo meeting in the UK. 2004.2 statistics. Update on the forums.
Infrastructure hardware donations. Project updates.
Gentoo Linux at Linux World Expo San Francisco. Update on the website redesign.
Gentoo Linux 2004.2 released. First Anniversary of BugDay. German GWN translation team seeking additional translators.
net-www being retired. Volunteers required: UK Meeting Organising Committee.
Gentoo MacOS X Released.
Portage update.
Gentoo announces web redesign contest. Bootsplash now working on PPC.
First Installation of Gentoo Linux on a Quadruple Opteron. Gentoo Present at the LinuxTag in Karlsruhe.
Announcing Wasabi 0.2. Gentoo Linux seeking new kernel developers.
Gentoo Not-For-Profit Paperwork complete. Ways to get involved: Introducing webapps-request@gentoo.org.
Introducing app-admin/wasabi, a log-monitoring tool. Some GLEP news.
Beta LiveCDs and stages for PPC64. Changes to net-mail/mailwrapper various related mail transfer agents. Gentoo/BSD seeking interested developers.
Various Gentoo Documentation Project updates. New Roles in Gentoo/PPC.
Gentoo Managers' Meeting Summary.
Gentoo Documenation Project Status Report. GLEP 26: kernel handling with Portage.
Gentoo Linux Chief Architect Daniel Robbins retires. 10th BugDay a big success.
New apache maintainer and public mailing list. Gentoo Linux seeking a new squid maintainer.
Transition to NFP organization.
Gentoo Weekly Newsletter reorganizing. Gentoo Linux Project seeking SAMBA developers.
Gentoo Linux Project seeking additional kernel developers. Gentoo Linux Newsletter seeking additional contributors.
Support for multiple MTAs with mailwrapper. Apache2 upgrade. Gentoo Linux seeking a dedicated Apache developer.
Security-only updates and stackable profiles.
2004.1 Release Information.
LinuxTag Cheminitz.
2004.0 Released.
FOSDEM Brussels 21 & 22 February 2004. Gentoo Linux still looking for an additional dialup developer.
Gentoo growing in popularity.
Gentoo Linux Project seeking an additional dialup developer. New gentoo-science maliing list.
Gentoo Managers' Meeting Summary - 12 Jan 2004 and 26 Jan 2004. Gentoo Linux BugDay on Saturday, February 7.
SELinux i686 LiveCD now available.
Gentoo Linux a finalist for LWE's "Best Open Source Project" award. Gentoo Linux Desktop Project Co-leads chosen.
2003 Gentoo Bug Hunt Winners.
Gentoo Managers' Meeting Summary - 15 December 2003.
First Anniversary of the Gentoo Weekly Newsletter. GWN Staff Profiles.
First Anniversary of Gentoo Weekly Newsletter next week.
Gentoo Managers' Meeting Summary: 1 Dec. 2003.
Gentoo: 2004 and beyond. Gentoo rsync.gentoo.org server compromised. 'emerge rsync' etiquette. More Praise: Linux Journal.
Gentoo Documentation Project looking for more translators. Praise for Gentoo Linux in Linux Weekly News.
Gentoo Managers' Meeting Summary - 17 November 2003. Gentoo Desktop update.
packages.gentoo.org now live. Porting "sandbox" to BSD libc.
Gentoo Managers' Meeting Summary - 3 November 2003.
Embedded Gentoo seeking interested developers.

Improved support for virtual hosting and web-based applications. 2.6 kernel LiveCDs available for x86 and amd64. Open kernel developer positions in the Gentoo Linux Project. GWN seeking additional contributor.
An update on GLEPs.
GNOME 2.4 marked stable on x86.
Gentoo Linux Performance Metrics.
BugDay on Saturday, October 4. Featured Sponsor - Oregon State University.
Gentoo 1.4 maintenance release 1 for x86. Experimental IA-64 stage1 available
Official Gentoo port to IA64 begun.
Second Gentoo BugDay a success.
Portage tarballs available for OpenBSD and FreeBSD. Second Gentoo BugDay to be held on September 6. Gentoo Documentation team looking for new French lead translator.
New experimental LiveCDs and stages released for the AMD64 platform. Gentoo Forums reach several new milestones
Gentoo migrates to a more robust DNS infrastructure. More photos from LWE.
Gentoo Linux at Linux World Expo. Gentoo Documentation Project looking for new lead Dutch translator.
Gentoo Linux at Linux World Expo on August 5-7. First Gentoo BugDay held on August 2. WineX ebuilds removed from Portage.
Radical changes to Perl module handling. First Gentoo Bug Day on August 2. Gentoo Linux 1.4 for PowerPC now available for pre-order. Indonesian documentation team in need of translators.

Gentoo Linux 1.4 to be released at LinuxWorld Expo. Gentoo Linux 1.4 available for pre-order. Open positions in the Gentoo Linux project. Introducing the Gentoo Server project. Bytemark Hosting begins offering Gentoo Linux
Gentoo Linux at LinuxTag. ViewCVS back up.

Kurt Lieber stepping down as editor of GWN. Gentoo coming to Windows with Cygwin. Milestone reached in herds project. Infrastructure changes. Controversy about inappropriate content in ebuilds. GWN seeking additional contributors.
Gentoo Linux adopts a new management structure. Fork of Gentoo Linux announced. GWN seeking additional translators.
Where is Gentoo Linux 1.4?. The Meta Package project. Two additional new source mirrors for North America. GWN looking for additional translators.
Gentoo Linux Enhancement Proposals. bugs.gentoo.org gets a new home.
Announcing Gentoo on MacOS X. Hardened Gentoo demonstrates SELinux. Open positions in the Gentoo Linux project
North America gets two new source mirrors. CFLAGS/cpuinfo collection project. Upcoming infrastructure changes.
Hardware failures on Oregon State mirror. Gentoo Linux is seeking developers for the GNOME team. Gentoo Linux in the news.
Announcing Gentoo Games, Inc. Gentoo Linux attends E3.
Gentoo Linux to make major announcement at E3. Gentoo Technologies to partner with Super Computer, Inc. to bring Gentoo Linux to the Opteron platform.
Feature list for next release of Gentoo Linux 1.4. Rsync etiquette guidelines. New mailing lists available.
Proposed changes to how ebuilds are managed. Mailing list changes. Early addition of tcl/tk

Portage security features detailed. Open positions with the Gentoo Linux project. Gentoo Linux is seeking additional source mirrors and colocation space. Gentoo Linux now available on the HPPA platform
Gentoo Linux 1.4_rc4 Released. New Unreal Tournament 2003 Game CD
Yes, it was a joke. Portage moves to a new, more secure format.
Portage 2.1 adopts RPM format, Gentoo/PPC team restructuring, Release schedule announced for 1.4_rc4
How to become a Gentoo developer, changes in the way Gentoo Linux supports CFLAGS, errata from last week's issue
Update from the Game Developers Conference, GWN looking for contributors, rsync.gentoo.org shows some strain, Gentoo Linux launches a "hardened Gentoo" effort, new items at the Gentoo Store
distcc in a nutshell and a remarkable response to our call for developers
Gentoo Linux at the Game Developers Conference, Open Developer Positions in the Gentoo Linux project, Gentoo Linux 1.4_rc3 released
Gentoo partners with NeTraverse. Gentoo Linux 1.4 update. Pictures of FOSDEM
Catch Gentoo Zetagrid fever. New rsync mirrors. Gnome 2.2 now in Portage
Gentoo Linux at FOSDEM, New Release Manager for 1.4, Icons for Gentoo Linux
KDE 3.1 Released, mirror slowness and Gentoo server migrations.
Gentoo Linux at LinuxWorld Expo. GLSAs being integrated into Portage. Fighting spam with SpamAssassin.
Next Release of Gentoo to rc3, Gentoo PPC Developer presents at MIT
Changes to Gentoo and gcc, Freezes to the Portage Tree and Gentoo Linux 1.4 Nears Completion
Portage, Perl and Prelinking updates, plus a chance to help Gentoo Linux
Gentoo at LinuxWorld Expo, 1.4 updates, New Kernel Strategy
Official Launch of GWN, Portage Snafu, CVSup vs. rsync, CVS Ebuild Policy

body.p: GWN은 번역에 참여하려는 지원자들을 기반으로 서로 다른 언어로 번역됩니다. 만약 여러분이 (번역본이 이미 제공되더라도)GWN을 어떤 언어로 번역하는 것을 도와주고 싶다면 gwn-feedback@gentoo.org 로 연락해 주세요. GWN이 한주에 한번씩 출판되고 대체로 내용이 길 수 있기 때문에, 우리는 많은 사람들이 같은 언어로 번역하는 것을 선호합니다. 작업의 부하를 줄여주고 사람들이 휴가를 가는 것 때문에 번역이 방해받지 않는 것을 보장해 줍니다.

section.title: GWN 메일링 리스트를 구독하거나 또는 구독하지 않으려면 어떻게 해야 하나요?
